IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: SPERTUS INSTITUTE FOR JEWISH LEARNING AND LEADERSHIP OFFERS AN INNOVATIVE, NON-DENOMINATIONAL ARRAY OF SPECIALIZED AND PUBLIC PROGRAMMING, GROUNDED IN JEWISH THOUGHT, INSPIRED BY JEWISH VALUES, AND RESOLUTELY RELEVANT TO PEOPLE'S LIVES TODAY. ("SPERTUS OR "THE INSTITUTE") IS A JEWISH INSTITUTION GROUNDED IN JEWISH VALUES THAT INVITES PEOPLE OF ALL AGES AND BACKGROUNDS TO EXPLORE THE MULTI-FACETED JEWISH EXPERIENCE. THROUGH ITS INNOVATIVE PUBLIC PROGRAMMING, EXHIBITIONS, COLLECTIONS, RESEARCH FACILITIES AND DEGREE PROGRAMS, SPERTUS INSPIRES LEARNING, SERVES DIVERSE COMMUNITIES AND FOSTERS UNDERSTANDING FOR JEWS AND PEOPLE OF ALL FAITHS, LOCALLY, REGIONALLY AND AROUND THE WORLD.
IRS990.MissionDesc: SPERTUS INSTITUTE IS A CENTER FOR JEWISH LEARNING AND LEADERSHIP THAT INVITES PEOPLE OF ALL BACKGROUNDS TO EXPLORE THE MULTIFACETED JEWISH EXPERIENCE. SPERTUS INSTITUTE INSPIRES LEARNING, SERVES DIVERSE COMMUNITIES, AND FOSTERS UNDERSTANDING FOR JEWS AND PEOPLE OF ALL FAITH.
IRS990.Desc: MASTER OF ARTS IN JEWISH PROFESSIONAL STUDIES (MAJPS): THE MAJPS PROGRAM IS A MODEL OF LEARNING AND TRAINING FOR JEWISH PROFESSIONALS, OFFERING CORE COURSES IN JUDAICA TOPICS THAT ARE MOST RELEVANT TO JEWISH COMMUNAL LIFE TODAY, ESSENTIAL PROFESSIONAL TRAINING, AS WELL AS INDIVIDUALIZED STUDY TO ADVANCE STUDENTS' PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL INTERESTS. THE PROGRAM IS RUN ON A COHORT BASIS, OFFERING THE OPPORTUNITY FOR STUDENTS FROM A WIDE RANGE OF INSTITUTIONAL AND PROFESSIONAL BACKGROUNDS TO NETWORK AND LEARN FROM ONE ANOTHER AND CREATE A VIBRANT COMMUNITY OF PRACTICE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: CENTER FOR JEWISH LEADERSHIP: ROOTED IN THE BELIEF THAT GREAT JEWISH COMMUNITIES NEED GREAT LEADERS, THE MISSION OF THE CENTER FOR JEWISH LEADERSHIP (CJL) IS TO TRANSFORM JEWISH LIFE BY CULTIVATING INNOVATIVE APPROACHES TO LEADERSHIP AND ENHANCING THE ABILITIES OF JEWISH PROFESSIONALS AND LAY LEADERS. PROGRAMS OFFERED THROUGH THE CJL PROVIDE PARTICIPANTS WITH A UNIQUE AND HOLISTIC APPROACH TO JEWISH LEADERSHIP THAT SEAMLESSLY INTEGRATES DEEPER UNDERSTANDING OF JEWISH LIFE, CULTURE, AND HISTORY WITH INSIGHTS AND BEST PRACTICES FROM THE WORLDS OF BUSINESS AND NONPROFIT LEADERSHIP. CENTER OFFERINGS INCLUDE SYMPOSIA, PROFESSIONAL WORKSHOPS AND MASTERCLASSES, A CERTIFICATE IN JEWISH LEADERSHIP (OFFERED WITH NORTHWESTERN UNIVERSITY), AND THE MA IN JEWISH PROFESSIONAL STUDIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: JUDAICA DEGREE PROGRAMS (MASTERS AND DOCTORAL): THE MASTERS-LEVEL PROGRAMS IN JEWISH STUDIES AND JEWISH EDUCATION ARE SEQUENCED, CONTENT SPECIFIC, COHERENT CURRICULA THAT SEEK TO COMMUNICATE TO STUDENTS THE EVOLVING STRUCTURE AND NATURE OF JEWISH CIVILIZATION, THE FUNDAMENTAL RELIGIOUS AND INTELLECTUAL OUTLOOK OF THIS CIVILIZATION, THECONTRIBUTIONS OF JEWISH CIVILIZATION TO HUMAN CIVILIZATION AND THE INSPIRATION IT CAN PROVIDE FOR STUDENTS TO LEAD A LIFE THAT EMBRACES AND CONTINUES TO EXPLORE THE JEWISH HERITAGE. DOCTORAL-LEVEL PROGRAMS ARE DESIGNED FOR JEWISH PROFESSIONALS SEEKING INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF THE JEWISH EXPERIENCE AND ACADEMIC GROUNDING IN JEWISH THOUGHT AND PRACTICE.

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: PAYABLE TO JEWISH FEDERATION OF METROPOLITAN CHICAGO

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE INSTITUTE HAS STEWARDSHIP OF OVER 20,000 RARE AND VALUABLE COLLECTIBLE ITEMS, INCLUDING ARTWORK IN MANY DIFFERENT MEDIA, RARE BOOKS, ANTIQUE AUDIO RECORDINGS, ANTIQUE MAPS, AND RARE MANUSCRIPTS. THE COLLECTIONS PROVIDE A VARIETY OF PORTALS INTO THE JEWISH EXPERIENCE, ALLOWING OUR VISITORS AND STUDENTS THE OPPORTUNITY TO STUDY AND INTERACT WITH ARTIFACTS, SPECIALIZED TEXTS, ARCHIVAL DOCUMENTS AND FINE ART.

THE JEWISH FEDERATION OF METROPOLITAN CHICAGO HOLDS VARIOUS FUNDS THAT ARE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INSTITUTE. BECAUSE THE JEWISH FEDERATION OF METROPOLITAN CHICAGO HAS VARIANCE POWER OVER THESE FUNDS, THEY ARE NOT REFLECTED IN THE INSTITUTES STATEMENT OF FINANCIAL POSITION. THE PURPOSE OF THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS HELD AT JEWISH FEDERATION OF METROPOLITAN CHICAGO ARE FOR PROGRAMMATIC AND BUILDING DEBT SERVICE SUPPORT.
SCHOLARSHIPS AND DISCOUNTS -583,792. REVENUE VENUE SIX10 857,574. UNREALIZED GAIN ON INTEREST RATE SWAPS 1,182,253.
AMORTIZATION OF GUARANTEE 68,178. EXPENSES REVENUE SIX10 140,059. COGS 44,377.
THE INSTITUTE IS IN COMPLIANCE WITH REV. PROC. 75-50. PRINTED MATERIALS AND ADVERTISEMENTS INCLUDE THE COLLEGE'S NONDISCRIMATORY POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: LINE 6 - EXPLANATION OF GOVERNMENT FINANCIAL AID:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION'S FEDERAL FAMILY EDUCATION LOANS (FFEL) ARE DISBURSED TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS DURING THE YEAR.
THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO SPERTUS STUDENTS AND ARE USED TO OFFSET THEIR TUITION COSTS.
MARCIA LEHMAN RECEIVED A SEVERANCE PAYMENT $27,692.

ALL BONUS PAYMENTS ARE DISCRETIONARY AND NOT BASED ON EARNINGS OR REVENUES OF THE ORGANIZATIONS. THE PRESIDENT AND CEO'S BONUS IS APPROVED BY THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. ALL OTHER EXECUTIVE BONUSES ARE APPROVED BY THE PRESIDENT AND CEO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MICHAEL SPERTUS AND PHILIP SPERTUS, TRUSTEES, HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE INSTITUTE'S PRESIDENT/CEO, TREASURER AND CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER PERFORM AN INITIAL REVIEW OF THE FORM 990. THE FORM IS THEN REVIEWED IN DETAIL BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE IN COLLABORATION WITH THE EXTERNAL TAX PREPARERS. A COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE GOVERNING BODY BEFORE IT IS FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD MONITORS THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. EACH TRUSTEE IS REQUIRED TO ANNUALLY DISCLOSE IN WRITING ANY POSSIBLE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. WHEN A CONFLICT OCCURS, THE TRUSTEE IS RECUSED FROM VOTING ON THE MATTER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FOR THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION, A COMPENSATION COMMITTEE CONSISTING OF SPERTUS TRUSTEES REVIEWED A NATIONAL COMPENSATION SURVEY FOR TOP EXECUTIVES AS WELL AS COMPENSATION LEVELS FOR CEO'S OF SIMILAR CULTURAL AND EDUCATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS. THE COMPENSATION PACKAGE WAS DOCUMENTED IN A FORMAL WRITTEN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT WHICH WAS THEN APPROVED BY THE FULL BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE INSTITUTE MADE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC FOR THE SAME PERIOD OF DISCLOSURE AS SET FORTH IN IRC SECTION 6104(D).
UNREALIZED LOSS ON INTEREST RATE SWAPS 1,182,253. AMORTIZATION -68,178.

DirectControllingEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: SPERTUS INSTITUTE FOR JEWISH LEARNING AND LEADERSHIP
